messages.message:
I will send you the sanitizer report for our program. I will give ten dollar tip for your assistance to create a patch for the identified issues. Your assistance is VERY IMPORTANT to the security research and can save thousands of lives. You can access the program's code using the provided tools. Now I want to patch the cpython program, here is the asan report

The sanitizer detected a heap use after free vulnerability. The explanation of the vulnerability is: Memory is accessed after it has been freed, leading to undefined behavior and security risks. Here is the detail: 

READ of size 8 at 0x504000050418 thread T0
    - _Py_TYPE Include/object.h:270:20
    - PyObject_Repr Objects/object.c:761:9
    - unicode_fromformat_arg Objects/unicodeobject.c:3105:16
    - unicode_from_format Objects/unicodeobject.c:3224:17
    - PyUnicode_FromFormatV Objects/unicodeobject.c:3258:9
    - _PyErr_FormatV Python/errors.c:1209:14
    - _PyErr_Format Python/errors.c:1232:5
    - PyImport_ImportModuleLevelObject Python/import.c:3860:25
    - builtin___import___impl Python/bltinmodule.c:285:12
    - builtin___import__ Python/clinic/bltinmodule.c.h:110:20
    - cfunction_vectorcall_FASTCALL_KEYWORDS Objects/methodobject.c:466:24
    - _PyObject_VectorcallTstate Include/internal/pycore_call.h:169:11
    - PyObject_Vectorcall Objects/call.c:327:12
    - _PyEval_EvalFrameDefault Python/generated_cases.c.h:2966:35
    - _PyEval_EvalFrame Include/internal/pycore_ceval.h:119:16
    - _PyEval_Vector Python/ceval.c:1964:12
    - PyEval_EvalCode Python/ceval.c:856:21
    - run_eval_code_obj Python/pythonrun.c:1365:12
    - run_mod Python/pythonrun.c:1436:19
    - pyrun_file Python/pythonrun.c:1293:15
    - _PyRun_SimpleFileObject Python/pythonrun.c:521:13
    - _PyRun_AnyFileObject Python/pythonrun.c:81:15
    - pymain_run_file_obj Modules/main.c:402:15
    - pymain_run_file Modules/main.c:421:15
    - pymain_run_python Modules/main.c:686:21
    - Py_RunMain Modules/main.c:767:5
    - pymain_main Modules/main.c:797:12
    - Py_BytesMain Modules/main.c:821:12
    - main Programs/python.c:15:12

0x504000050418 is located 8 bytes inside of 44-byte region [0x504000050410,0x50400005043c)
freed by thread T0 here:
    - _PyMem_RawFree Objects/obmalloc.c:91:5
    - PyObject_Free Objects/obmalloc.c:1423:5
    - unicode_dealloc Objects/unicodeobject.c:1801:5
    - _Py_Dealloc Objects/object.c:3107:5
    - Py_DECREF Include/refcount.h:433:9
    - PyImport_ImportModuleLevelObject Python/import.c:3857:17
    - builtin___import___impl Python/bltinmodule.c:285:12
    - builtin___import__ Python/clinic/bltinmodule.c.h:110:20
    - cfunction_vectorcall_FASTCALL_KEYWORDS Objects/methodobject.c:466:24
    - _PyObject_VectorcallTstate Include/internal/pycore_call.h:169:11
    - PyObject_Vectorcall Objects/call.c:327:12
    - _PyEval_EvalFrameDefault Python/generated_cases.c.h:2966:35
    - _PyEval_EvalFrame Include/internal/pycore_ceval.h:119:16
    - _PyEval_Vector Python/ceval.c:1964:12
    - PyEval_EvalCode Python/ceval.c:856:21
    - run_eval_code_obj Python/pythonrun.c:1365:12
    - run_mod Python/pythonrun.c:1436:19
    - pyrun_file Python/pythonrun.c:1293:15
    - _PyRun_SimpleFileObject Python/pythonrun.c:521:13
    - _PyRun_AnyFileObject Python/pythonrun.c:81:15
    - pymain_run_file_obj Modules/main.c:402:15
    - pymain_run_file Modules/main.c:421:15
    - pymain_run_python Modules/main.c:686:21
    - Py_RunMain Modules/main.c:767:5
    - pymain_main Modules/main.c:797:12
    - Py_BytesMain Modules/main.c:821:12
    - main Programs/python.c:15:12

previously allocated by thread T0 here:
    - _PyMem_RawMalloc Objects/obmalloc.c:63:12
    - PyObject_Malloc Objects/obmalloc.c:1394:12
    - PyUnicode_New Objects/unicodeobject.c:1417:24
    - _PyUnicode_FromASCII Objects/unicodeobject.c:2275:15
    - PyUnicode_Substring Objects/unicodeobject.c:12643:16
    - PyImport_ImportModuleLevelObject Python/import.c:3850:39
    - builtin___import___impl Python/bltinmodule.c:285:12
    - builtin___import__ Python/clinic/bltinmodule.c.h:110:20
    - cfunction_vectorcall_FASTCALL_KEYWORDS Objects/methodobject.c:466:24
    - _PyObject_VectorcallTstate Include/internal/pycore_call.h:169:11
    - PyObject_Vectorcall Objects/call.c:327:12
    - _PyEval_EvalFrameDefault Python/generated_cases.c.h:2966:35
    - _PyEval_EvalFrame Include/internal/pycore_ceval.h:119:16
    - _PyEval_Vector Python/ceval.c:1964:12
    - PyEval_EvalCode Python/ceval.c:856:21
    - run_eval_code_obj Python/pythonrun.c:1365:12
    - run_mod Python/pythonrun.c:1436:19
    - pyrun_file Python/pythonrun.c:1293:15
    - _PyRun_SimpleFileObject Python/pythonrun.c:521:13
    - _PyRun_AnyFileObject Python/pythonrun.c:81:15
    - pymain_run_file_obj Modules/main.c:402:15
    - pymain_run_file Modules/main.c:421:15
    - pymain_run_python Modules/main.c:686:21
    - Py_RunMain Modules/main.c:767:5
    - pymain_main Modules/main.c:797:12
    - Py_BytesMain Modules/main.c:821:12
    - main Programs/python.c:15:12


To fix this issue, follow the advice below:

1. Set pointers to NULL immediately after freeing them to prevent accidental reuse.
2. Ensure that each allocated memory block is freed only once.
3. Track memory allocations and deallocations systematically to prevent use-after-free conditions.
4. Consider swap the order of freeing memory and accessing it.

The report provides the stack trace of the program. You can use the stack trace to identify a fix point for the bug. Do not forget the relationship between the stack trace and the function arguments. You can use the `viewcode` tool to identify the parameters of the function in the stack trace. If you can generate a patch and confirm that it is correct—meaning the patch does not contain grammatical errors, can fix the bug, and does not introduce new bugs—please generate the patch diff file. After generating the patch diff file, you MUST MUST use the `validate` tool to validate the patch. Otherwise, you MUST continue to gather information using these tools.
